info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:23AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Jefferson County through 1100 AM CDT... At 1023 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fairfield. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Birmingham, Bessemer, Homewood, Mountain Brook, Hueytown, Fairfield, Pleasant Grove, Midfield, Brighton, Lipscomb, Birmingham Fairgounds, B.j.c.c., Edgewater, Five Points South, Ensley, Legion Field, Forestdale, U.A.B. Campus, Birmingham Southern College and McDonald Chapel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
